required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Multimodal Analgesic Protocol to Moderate Acute Pain
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective, Observational Study With a Multimodal Analgesic Protocol to Moderate Acute Pain After Third Molar Surgery

lead_sponsor.agency: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill

clinical_study.source: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill

brief_summary.textblock: With a prospective, observational study assess post-surgery pain levels and patient's use of opioids and other analgesic drugs to moderate pain following third molar surgery.

detailed_description.textblock:
SPECIFIC AIMS Using the UNC surgery clinic multi-modal protocol of drugs/dosages to control acute pain after third molar surgery assess each post-surgery day(PSD) the patient reported
1. pain levels post-surgery as recorded by Likert-type and Gracely scales
2. quality of life(QOL) outcomes for lifestyle and oral function
3. number of opioid doses taken by subject-patients
4. number of NSAID and acetaminophen doses taken by subject-patients.

primary_outcome.measure: The impact of the surgery on the patient's post-surgery pain.
primary_outcome.description: Likert scales for average pain and worst pain are assessed with 7-point scales with verbal anchors of "no pain" and "worst pain imagined". Recovery for pain on the Likert scales is defined as the number of PSD until the patient reports a score of 1 or 2 on the 7-point scale.

intervention.description: The patient is asked to complete the diary each post-surgery day for 14 days. Recovery is organized into three QOL domains: lifestyle, oral function, and pain.

study_pop.textblock: Patients scheduled for surgery at UNC oral and maxillofacial surgery clinic

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ASA I,II At least two lower 3rd molars scheduled for removal
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient being treated for opioid addiction/abuse including having Rx for suboxone, methadone

facility.name: University of North Carolina School of Dentistry

contact.last_name: Raymond P White Jr, DDS, PhD

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill
responsible_party.investigator_full_name: Raymond P White, Jr DDS, PhD
